title: 1972), and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation (EU) 2018/1672
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Controls of Cash
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Controls of Cash 

Entering or Leaving the Union) Regulations 2025.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (controls cash entering leaving union) regulation 2025

title: 1972), and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation (EU) 2018/1672
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 August 2025.
text_raw: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 August 2025.

title: 1972), and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation (EU) 2018/1672
heading: 3. Section 42 of the Customs Act 2015 (No. 18 of 2015) is amended—
text_raw:
3. Section 42 of the Customs Act 2015 (No. 18 of 2015) is amended— 

(a) 

by the substitution of the following subsection for subsection 
(12): 

“(12) A person who fails to— 

(a) make a correct and complete declaration as required 

by subsection (2)(a), or 

(b) make cash available for control as required by 

subsection (2)(b), 

commits an offence and is liable— 

(i) 

on summary conviction, to a class A fine or 
imprisonment for a term not exceeding 12 
months, or both, or 

(ii) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not 
exceeding €500,000, or imprisonment for a 
term not exceeding 3 years, or both.”, 

and 

(b) by the substitution of the following subsection for subsection 

(13): 

“(13) A person who fails to— 

(a) make a correct and complete disclosure declaration 
within 30 days in accordance with a notice under 
subsection (3)(a), or 

(b) make unaccompanied cash available for control as 

required by subsection (3)(c), 

1 OJ No. L 284, 12.11.2018, p. 6. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 18th July, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [318] 3 

commits an offence and is liable— 

(i) 

on summary conviction, to a class A fine or 
imprisonment for a term not exceeding 12 
months, or both, or 

(ii) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not 
exceeding €500,000 or imprisonment for a term 
not exceeding 3 years, or both.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

14 July, 2025. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 
Minister for Finance. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [318]
